intro: Tricarpha, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to various regions in Africa and are characterized by their distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow or orange flowers. Tricarpha species are typically shrubs or small trees, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. They produce capsules as fruits, which contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant's latex sap is milky and can be toxic, which contributes to its common name.
